Subpoena.definition: a writ commanding a designated person upon whom it has been served to appear

alsosub·pe·na[sə-pē-nə].definition: [Latinunder penalty]a writ commanding a designated person upon whom it has been served to appear (as in court or before a congressional committee) under a penalty (as a charge of contempt) for failure to comply compare

-na·ing.definition: to call before a court or hearing by a subpoena [the inspector is given the power to any relevant…witnesses ""]to command the production of (evidence) by a subpoena duces tecum [documents]
